title: Burglar breaks into sex shop but passes on £25,000 of equipment to watch porn then steal inflatable love doll
text:
News Burglar breaks into sex shop but passes on £25,000 of equipment to watch porn then steal inflatable love doll He ignored thousands of pounds worth of other toys in the shop in Greater Manchester in favour of the Heidi Lauritsen blow-up doll Share The owner of the shop believes the thief was an 'embarrassed customer' (Photo: MEN WS) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A lusty burglar broke into a sex shop - then watched a porn film and before stealing a love doll. 
The thief smashed his way into The Adult Shop in Bury, Greater Manchester through the roof, causing £1,500 of damage. 
He then browsed the store's sex toys , but clearly had his eyes on one particular product - a £300 Heidi Lauritsen life size inflatable doll. 
But he wasn't done, as he then appeared to have watched a pornographic DVD that was sitting on the shop's counter. This is the Heidi doll the thief had it away with (Photo: MEN WS) 
He then finally fled back through the hole in the roof with only the doll in his possession. 
Owner Alan Brook told the Manchester Evening News : “I don’t see a need to break in. We are cheap enough. Don’t be shy. Give us a try.” 
When Alan arrived at the shop the morning after the theft last Sunday, he found the DVD the man had watched was still playing on a loop, and realised what had happened. 
He also found all the items were still in the shop, except for the Heidi doll, although the box it sits in was left behind by the burglar. 
Alan said: "There’s a lot of valuable stuff here he could have taken, like a computer and DVD player and a £10,000 photocopier. 
"There must be £25,000 of kit in there but that doll was the only thing that was taken. 
"It makes me wonder whether somebody has broken in just to steal that doll. That’s certainly the impression the police gave me. 
“It’s obvious they’ve also been watching porn on the office computer, the cheeky bugger. But apart from the damage, nothing else has been stolen. 
“It’s probably cost me £1,500 to fix the roof and the ceiling.” 
He added: “I’ve been here 42 years and we’ve only been robbed a couple of times. 
"Once someone came through the shop window and took a load of DVDs. But on this occasion they’ve only taken one item.” Like us on Facebook
